# üìä Daily Mood Tracker

[![JavaScript](https://img.shields.io/badge/JavaScript-F7DF1E?style=for-the-badge&logo=javascript&logoColor=black)](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript)
[![HTML5](https://img.shields.io/badge/HTML5-E34F26?style=for-the-badge&logo=html5&logoColor=white)](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML)
[![CSS3](https://img.shields.io/badge/CSS3-1572B6?style=for-the-badge&logo=css3&logoColor=white)](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS)
[![LocalStorage](https://img.shields.io/badge/LocalStorage-4285F4?style=for-the-badge&logo=data:image/png;base64,)](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Window/localStorage)

## üìù Project Description

The Daily Mood Tracker is a web application that allows users to track their emotional state over time. Users can select their current mood from a set of emoji options, and the application stores this information locally, enabling users to view their mood history by day, week, or month.

## ‚ú® Features

- **Mood Selection**: Choose from 5 different emotions (happy, sad, neutral, excited, angry)
- **Multiple View Options**:
  - Day view: See your mood for the current day
  - Week view: View your moods for the entire week
  - Month view: Track your emotional patterns throughout the month
- **Persistent Storage**: Data is saved locally using browser's localStorage API
- **Visual Feedback**: Emotions are displayed with corresponding emojis
- **Responsive Design**: Works on various device sizes

## üõ†Ô∏è Technologies Used

- **HTML5**: Structure of the web application
- **CSS3**: Styling and responsive design
- **JavaScript**: Core functionality and DOM manipulation
- **Local Storage API**: Data persistence between sessions

## üìã Implementation Details

The application has several key components:

1. **Mood Selection System**:
   - Click on an emoji to record your mood for the day
   - Each mood is saved with the current date
   - If you select a different mood on the same day, it updates your previous entry

2. **Data Storage**:
   - Uses the browser's localStorage API
   - Mood data is stored as a JSON array with date and emotion properties
   - The application checks if an entry for the current date already exists before adding a new one

3. **View Options**:
   - Day view shows a single mood entry
   - Week view displays entries for the current week (Sunday to Saturday)
   - Month view shows entries for all days in the current month

4. **Helper Functions**:
   - `formatDate()`: Converts ISO date strings to human-readable format
   - `getEmoji()`: Maps mood strings to corresponding emoji characters
   - `getWeekRangeFromDate()`: Calculates the date range for the current week

## üöÄ How to Use

1. Open the application in a web browser
2. Click on the emoji that best represents your current mood
3. Use the view buttons (Day, Week, Month) to navigate through your mood history
4. Your mood data will be saved automatically and persists between browser sessions

## üß© Code Structure

- **HTML**: Contains the structure of the application, including mood selection buttons and display areas
- **CSS**: Provides styling for the application interface
- **JavaScript**: Handles all functionality including:
  - Event listeners for emoji and view buttons
  - Local storage management
  - Date formatting and calculations
  - Dynamic content rendering based on selected view

## üìà Future Improvements

- Add authentication to allow users to access their mood data across devices
- Implement data visualization with charts to better analyze mood patterns
- Add note-taking functionality to provide context for mood entries
- Create reminders to encourage daily mood tracking
- Add export functionality to download mood history
